Package doa.engine.scene

Class DoaObjectBuilder<T extends DoaObject>

java.lang.Object
doa.engine.scene.DoaObjectBuilder<T>
Type Parameters:
T - type of the instantiated object
@Deprecated(since="3.0",
            forRemoval=true)
public class DoaObjectBuilder<T extends DoaObject>
extends java.lang.Object
Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
This class and all of its functionality has been deprecated and will be removed at some future date. Create DoaObjects by calling their constructors and add them to DoaScenes by calling DoaScene.add(DoaObject).
Builder for instantiating sub-classes of DoaObject.
Since:
DoaEngine 2.7
Version:
3.0
Author:
Doga Oruc

    • instantiate

      public T instantiate()
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      Instantiates a new DoaObject by finding a suitable constructor using the constructor arguments set by args(Object...) method. If no constructor arguments are set, the builder will try to invoke the no argument constructor. If a no argument constructor is present, the object will be successfully instantiated and returned, otherwise a DoaObjectInstantiationException will be thrown.

      The instantiated DoaObject will also be added to the scene set by scene(DoaScene) method. If no scene is set, the builder will add the instantiated DoaObject to the currently loaded scene. If no scene is set AND no scene is loaded at the time of this method's invocation, the instantiated DoaObject will not be added to any scene.

      Returns:
      the instantiated DoaObject or null if instantiation is unsuccessful due to an internal error
      Throws:
      DoaObjectInstantiationException - if supplied parameters cannot be used with a constructor

    • instantiateAndReset

      public T instantiateAndReset()
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      Instantiates a new DoaObject then resets the builders constructorArgs and scene fields. Calls instantiate() and returns the return value. Any and all exceptions that may be thrown by instantiate() can also be thrown by this method.
      Returns:
      the instantiated DoaObject
      See Also:
      instantiate()
